place_detail.name: location_type
place_detail.label: I am a small landowner in Kittitas County

fields.name: fire_environment_info
fields.content:
Since 2008, wildfires have burned nearly 2 million acres in Washington State. This map visualizes where fires tend to start.

9,689Total fires started since 20081,705,602Total acres burned

fields.name: large_fires_information
fields.content:
Kittitas County is in the heart of fire-prone country. 36 large fires have burned here since 1973, the largest of which was the Colockum Tarps fire in 2013. Hover over fires on the map to learn more about them [to come].

36Large wildfires started since 1973227,533Total acres burned

fire_resiliency_information.content:
Be resilient! As a landowner in a fire environment, what you do (and don't do!) on your property matters.

Tell us a bit about your property and practices, and we'll give you some practical tips for becoming even more wildfire resilient.

We'll ask about your fire resiliency practices in three zones around your property:

  • Immediate Zone: 0 - 5 feet from house
  • Intermediate Zone: 5 - 30 feet from house
  • Extended Zone: 30 - 100 feet from house

immediate_zone_information.content: The immediate zone extends to five feet from your house. This zone is the most vulnerable to embers. Start here with your fire resiliency efforts.

intermediate_zone_information.content: The intermediate zone extends between five and thirty feet from your house.

extended_zone_information.content: The extended zone extends between thirty and one hundred feet from your house.

clean_roofs.prompt: I clean roofs and gutters of dead leaves, debris and pine needles that could catch embers
clean_roofs.label: Clean roofs and gutters

replace_shingles.prompt: I replace or repair any loose or missing shingles or roof tiles to prevent ember penetration
replace_shingles.label: Replace or repair loose shingles

reduce_embers.prompt: I reduce embers that could pass through vents in the eaves by installing 1/8 inch metal mesh screening
reduce_embers.label: Reduce embers

clean_debris_attic_vents.prompt: I clean debris from exterior attic vents and install 1/8 inch metal mesh screening to reduce embers
clean_debris_attic_vents.label: Clean debris from attic vents

repair_screens.prompt: I repair or replace damaged or loose window screens and any broken windows screen or box-in areas below patios and decks with wire mesh to prevent debris and combustible materials from accumulating
repair_screens.label: Repair or replace window screens

move_flammable_material.prompt: I move any flammable material away from wall exteriors – mulch, flammable plants, leaves and needles, firewood piles – anything that can burn. Remove anything stored underneath decks or porches
move_flammable_material.label: Move flammable material

clear_vegetation.prompt: I clear vegetation from under large stationary propane tanks
clear_vegetation.label: Clear vegetation from propane tanks

create_fuel_breaks.prompt: I create fuel breaks with driveways, walkways/paths, patios, and decks
create_fuel_breaks.label: Create fuel breaks

mow_to_four_inches.prompt: I keep lawns and native grasses mowed to a height of four inches
mow_to_four_inches.label: Keep lawns mowed to four inches

remove_ladder_fuels.prompt: I remove ladder fuels (vegetation under trees) so a surface fire cannot reach the crowns. Prune trees up to six to ten feet from the ground; for shorter trees do not exceed 1/3 of the overall tree height
remove_ladder_fuels.label: Remove ladder fuels

space_trees.prompt: I space trees to have a minimum of eighteen feet between crowns with the distance increasing with the percentage of slope
space_trees.label: Space trees to eighteen feet

tree_placement.prompt: I ensure that mature tree canopy is no closer than ten feet to the edge of structures on my property
tree_placement.label: Keep tree canopy ten feet from structures

small_tree_clusters.prompt: I ensure that tree and shrubs in the intermediate zone are limited to small clusters of a few each to break up the continuity of the vegetation across the landscape
small_tree_clusters.label: Break up continuity of vegetation

dispose_ground_debris.prompt: I dispose of heavy accumulations of ground litter/debris
dispose_ground_debris.label: Disponse of ground debris

remove_dead_material.prompt: I regularly remove dead plant and tree material
remove_dead_material.label: Remove dead plant material

remove_small_conifers.prompt: I remove small conifers growing between mature trees
remove_small_conifers.label: Remove small conifers between mature trees

remove_outbuilding_vegetation.prompt: I remove vegetation adjacent to storage sheds or other outbuildings
remove_outbuilding_vegetation.label: Remove adjacent outbuilding vegetation

space_canopy_tops_30_60_feet.prompt: I ensure that trees 30 to 60 feet from the home should have at least 12 feet between canopy tops
space_canopy_tops_30_60_feet.label: Space canopy tops 30 to 60 feet from the house

space_canopy_tops_60_100_feet.prompt: I ensure that trees 60 to 100 feet from the home should have at least 6 feet between the canopy tops
space_canopy_tops_60_100_feet.label: Space canopy tops 60 to 100 feet from the house

evacuation_plan.prompt: I have an evacuation plan that includes escape routes, a designated family meeting location, and a communication plan
evacuation_plan.label: Evacuation plan

food_and_water.prompt: My kit includes a three-day supply of non-perishable food and three gallons of water per person
food_and_water.label: Food and water

medications.prompt: My kit includes prescriptions or special medications
medications.label: Prescriptions and medications

clothing.prompt: My kit includes a change of clothing for each person
clothing.label: Change of clothing

eyeglasses.prompt: My kit includes extra eyeglasses or contact lenses
eyeglasses.label: Eyeglasses or contact lenses

car_keys_money.prompt: My kit includes an extra set of car keys, credit card, cash or traveler's checks
car_keys_money.label: Car keys and extra money

first_aid_kit.prompt: My kit includes first aid supplies
first_aid_kit.label: First aid supplies

radio.prompt: My kit includes a battery-powered radio and extra batteries
radio.label: Battery-powered radio

documents.prompt: My kit includes copies of important documents, such as birth certificates, passports, etc.
documents.label: Copies of documents

pet_food.prompt: My kit includes pet food and water
pet_food.label: Pet food and water

content: Your Garfield County VSP Coordinators are interested in helping meet your stewardship goals.
Contact a local VSP Coordinator or for more information visit: www.garfieldcountyvsp.com.

Welcome Kittitas County Landowners!

Get Started
The Kittitas County Firewise Program is designed to educate landowners and others about wildfire risk in their communities, and about how to prepare for the next wildfire.
